name: palaeogene
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
from or referring to the period of time between about 66 and 23 million years ago, in which many insects, mammals, and birds appeared: the Palaeogene period Palaeogene flora and fauna
More examplesFewer examplesThe earliest Palaeogene landscape was covered by ferns.The ancestors of modern camels evolved in North America during the Palaeogene period.In England, Palaeogene rocks are preserved in two E–W trending tectonic basins, the London Basin and the Hampshire Basin.

the Palaeogene
the period of time between about 66 and 23 million years ago, in which many insects, mammals, and birds appeared: In the Early Palaeogene, the earth was mainly made up of forests and woodlands. Sea-level change in the Late Palaeogene exposed the present-day lowland landscape.
More examplesFewer examplesSouth America was an island during the Palaeogene.Scientists previously believed dyrosaurids diversified in the Palaeogene.Across ecosystems, the Palaeogene also marks a rapid radiation of new species filling in empty ecological niches.
